Hello  Mbarara,  I am glad to be here and to receive such a warm welcome by you. For you to receive me in such large numbers is gratifying.
I have come here today to ask for your vote in next years general elections. I know you must be asking yourselves why?
Tomorrow we shall launch the Manifesto and answer that question. What can we do now that we failed in thirty years?
For starters I wasn’t President so I had no executive powers to make bold decisions.  Since independence, we have failed as a people to have
peaceful transfer of power. I ask now that you put me in that position where I will oversee that peaceful transition. The “Chair” ....
The “Chair” is the most significant symbol for this election because it represents change. Not just change of leadership but real change.
Tomorrow we shall discuss how we plan on implementing that change. I only ask that nobody should be left behind. We will make proposals on..
Proposals on employment, Medicare, infrastructure development, clean water, & most importantly taxation and how we plan on changing it.
The Compensation to government workers and how to ensure efficient government. We will also discuss the issue of pensions.
We will discuss restoration of term limits as well as the future for our next generation. As a parent I urge you to consider....
I urge you to consider the type of future you are leaving for your children. Together we can create a Uganda that works for everyone.
